results.title: The Shot
results.creator_credit: Tim Kreibig, Puven Pather and AFTRS
results.brief_description: After a prolonged career as a war correspondent photographer, Mick thinks he can see through the horror of the environment he works in, until he falls victim to his own convictions! A look into the moral and ethical dilemmas of a war correspondent. Cast features Tony Martin as Mick and mark Lee as Terry.

results.title: Jake: today I became a man
results.brief_description: Jake is an extraordinary child who just so happens to love dressing up and performing. His resolution to be himself and carve out an identity for himself regardless of societal expectations is inspiring. A remarkable story told in Jake’s language in which he articulately discusses growing up and his love of singing and performing in drag. An eye opening piece which challenges assumptions of personal identity and that kids do understand themselves and their ‘place’ in the world.

results.title: Relative strangers
results.brief_description:
Simon thought he knew his parents… A film about a family, a deception and its legacy.
The visual effects in this film were all camera-created, using a technique of projection onto a moving sheet to create the insubstantial and constantly changing images that reflect the perceptions of the narrator (Simon Cooper). Nothing in his world turned out to be what it first seemed.

results.title: Jagged edge
results.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Martin Ransohoff and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A well-crafted, hardboiled mystery with sharp perfromances by murder suspect Jeff Bridges and tough-but-smitten defense attorney Glenn Close. The murder victim was a socialite and heiress. Her husband (James Bridges), an upwardly mobile newspaper publisher, now owns his wife’s fortune. Embittered by past experiences with criminal law, Close is pressed to defend Bridges, once he convinces her of his innocence. This movie raises jagged questions about an imperfect justice system and will leave you guessing until the very end - did he or didn’t he? Robert Loggia received a 1985 Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actor.

results.title: Money movement mindset
results.brief_description: Annoying finance bros beware: the comedians are coming for your grindset! Financial planning is a popular podcast and video genre online — but many of them are hosted by young men whose views on how to make bank can be hilariously macho, and based on an unrealistic picture of how and why most people spend their money. In this video, Tiktok comedian Caroline Baniewicz skewers finance bro culture, satirising the impractical ways that these podcasters advise on making your first million.
results.description: Annoying finance bros beware: the comedians are coming for your grindset! Financial planning is a popular podcast and video genre online — many of them hosted by young men whose views on how to make bank can be hilariously macho and out of touch. In this video, Tiktok comedian Caroline Baniewicz skewers finance bro culture, satirising the impractical ways that these podcasters advise on making your first million.

results.title: Monet's garden at Giverny
results.creator_credit: Emma Ford, Sadie Hennessy and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description: The great impressionist Monet created his most inspirational subject on his own doorstep; Giverny is a garden that was planted to be painted. The production crew of this outstanding documentary were given unlimited access to Monet’s estate for a year, which allows the viewer to witness the full cycle of the seasons. Monet was a passionate horticulturalist who invested a lot of time in the garden at Giverny; this programme explores the enduring legacy of beauty that he left in the garden and in his art, and the incredible interrelationship between the two. Includes interviews with artists Kaffe Fassett and Paul Riley and photographer and Monet authority Vivian Russell.
